title: Brown men and red sand (A)
creator_contributor_role: South Australian Government Tourist Bureau, production company
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Aboriginal Australia/Aboriginal Australians - Social life and customs
description: This film is part of the original silent film record of C.P. Mountford's Central Australian journey with a group of desert Aborigines. From the original footage the two popular sound films, "Walkabout" and "Tjurunga", were compiled. "Brown men and red sand" (if projected at silent speed) shows the movements of the Aborigines, especially in the sequences dealing with tribal ceremonies and dances, more naturally than in the sound films, where the movements look jerky.
